channel.title: Thinking about buying a Mountain bike
channel.description:
Yea so my old bike got stolen last year.. Now its beginning to be warm again im thinking of buying another bike
I want to spend no more then £500 on one and im stuck between these two:
[b]Carrera Banshee [/b]
http://www.halfords.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/product_storeId_10001_catalogId_10151_productId_518221_langId_-1_categoryId_165499
[b]VooDoo HooDoo[/b]
http://www.halfords.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/product_storeId_10001_catalogId_10151_productId_786847_langId_-1_categoryId_165499#dtab
Ideas?
PS: Don't say "Halfords is shit" Some people think it is, I got my last bike from there and didn't have any trouble with it at all.

item.title: Thinking about buying a Mountain bike
item.dc:creator: @Phillipe Phillipé
item.description:
@Phillipe wrote:

sanga282:

my mate works at halford, he just builds his own bike basically from parts says its a lot better that way and he nicks the occasional part from halfords

Depends on what he can get, for 500 I wouldn’t bother - A decent, lightweight alloy frame that can cope with trail, road and offroad with decent shocks, double wall rims, crank set, gearing and brakes will cost about the same to make as to buy online from our site (we’re competitive and offer massive discounts for no fucking reason but annoying people who work in store with reserve and collects).

It cost me about 700 to build one of my bikes from scratch, 7071 alloy frame etc and now VooDoo have the same frames with a little downgrade in the brakes and gears (Mine are elixir 3’s and SRAM X9’s) for about 200 quid cheaper.

item.title: Thinking about buying a Mountain bike
item.dc:creator: @Phillipe Phillipé
item.description:
@Phillipe wrote:

I work at halfords, mostly on the bike hut but I’m an audio fitter aswell.

The voodoo hoodoo is a lot better bike in comparison to the Banshee - I wouldn’t be buying one at the minute anyway, we’re soon to be launching and re branding Carrera bikes as “Exclusively Sold by Halfords” as we do with the Boardmans, which we in fact own and make. Seen the new prototypes of the Carrera’s at a big meeting in Manchester the other week, they were good in spec but still don’t match up.

If I were you, depending on what you want to do with the bike I’d weigh up your options - go in store, describe what you want, your riding style and your preference in spec (if you really know what you want) and they’ll point you in the right direction, if not hit me up with a pm.

item.title: Thinking about buying a Mountain bike
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Both don’t look terrible, but obviously for that price you won’t get a top model. As long as the frame is the right size, it’ll be fine. I used to ride a mountainbike, but I got serious back pain when I was on it. So I switched to a racing bicycle not too long ago, and only cycle on roads now. Much faster, and surprisingly no back pain either.
